content.description:
P1-11a, 90', 10 bolts: Climb along the slabby flakes, which gradually steepen, to reach a small right-facing dihedral/overhang. Step and palm left to the anchors. Rappel or climb less continuous second pitch.

P2-10c, ~110', bolted: Move left on the ledge and climb the short, steep headwall to gain the easier ramp above and continue to coldshuts.
content.location: Starts from the right shoulder of Rendezvous Buttress below a large, right-leaning overhanging arete. A short, 5.0 easy, bolted pitch traverses left to the start of the climb. Bolted belay anchors at the start.

content.description: Climb the slabby face to the right facing dihedral.
content.location: Located on the South-facing Rendezvous Buttress Slab to the right of Ramset.

content.description: Climbs the left side of the slab to the right of the large wide crack.
content.protection: Bolts and possibly gear to coldshuts.
content.location: Located on the left side of the South-facing Rendezvous Buttress Slab.

content.description: Two 90-foot pitches lead to the SW corner of the Upper Ramp. Aim for two angle iron hangers that are visible at 35 feet up, then trend left to a ledge with coldshut anchors. The second pitch wanders to the SW corner of the Upper Ramp, but has one bolt at its crux.
content.protection: Few bolts, mostly gear to coldshuts.
content.location: Starts 40 feet right of the overhanging incline face.

content.description: Climbs the right side of the Slab. Some of the bolts were placed to protect both an easy option and a more difficult way.
content.location: Located on the right side of the South-facing Rendezvous Buttress Slab.

content.description: Offset Roof uses a line about 30 feet left of the Cobbled Corner and may or may not pass through the open book.  At about 145 feet undercling the horizontal roof crack left to a vertical, thin crack on a green lichen face. The chain anchors are about 20 feet above the roof edge.
content.protection: Bolts, nuts, RPs, and cams to coldshuts.
content.location: Starts about 30 feet left of the Cobbled Corner.

content.description: Short, fun route ascends the left face of the sheltered alcove and steps right at the top.
content.location: Starts 10 feet left of the chimney formed by the slab of Rendezvous Buttress.

content.description: Ascends the ramp past Crossover (right of) and continues up the steep, blocky features.

content.location: Located on the South-facing Rendezvous Buttress Slab to the left of President's Ride.

content.description: Ascends the ramp past Crossover, past the unnamed 5.11, and then up the steep, blocky features.
Cobbled Corner climbs the blocky, innermost corner of the large left-facing dihedral avoiding the offwidth sections.
These two splitter cracks lie above and left of the Rendezvous Buttress summit, where the slabby apron of the buttress meets the main headwall.
content.protection: Bolts, small nuts and cams to coldshuts.

content.description: Aim for and pass through the 15-foot long open book that is about 15 feet left of the blocky innermost corner. Coldshuts are at the top of this corner.
content.location: Starts about 20 feet left of the large left-facing, blocky dihedral.

content.description: A couple discontinuous systems of thin cracks extend above the right side of the Rendezvous Buttress Slab.
content.protection: Thin Gear, some belay coldshuts up and right.
content.location: Above and right of the Rendezvous Buttress Slab.

pathTokens: Laramie Peak Wildlife Habitat Management Area
